html: Great news! The May Jobs Report came out & the economy is booming. The U.S. added 159,000 jobs in April & 155,000 in March. The unemployment rate unexpectedly fell to 3.8% in May-the lowest reading since 1969. Average hourly earnings rose by 8 cents to $26.92 in May.pic.twitter.com/wngkOsywwb
text:
Great news! The May Jobs Report came out & the economy is booming.

 The U.S. added 159,000 jobs in April & 155,000 in March. 

 The unemployment rate unexpectedly fell to 3.8% in May-the lowest reading since 1969.

 Average hourly earnings rose by 8 cents to $26.92 in May.pic.twitter.com/wngkOsywwb

html: @RepHensarling notes the regulatory burden that's hurting America's Credit Unions and community banks. Urges support for HR 3971, Community Institution Mortgage Relief Act of 2017 led by @RepTenney #CommonSenseReg
text: @RepHensarling notes the regulatory burden that's hurting America's Credit Unions and community banks. Urges support for HR 3971, Community Institution Mortgage Relief Act of 2017 led by @RepTenney #CommonSenseReg

html: Regulations like these are the reason that America continues to lose one community bank per day on average. It's time to roll back regulations so our community institutions can become active in residential mortgage lending once again and help our rural, underserved areas thrive.
text: Regulations like these are the reason that America continues to lose one community bank per day on average. It's time to roll back regulations so our community institutions can become active in  residential mortgage lending once again and help our rural, underserved areas thrive.

html: The House is now considering HR 3971, the Community Institution Mortgage Relief Act of 2017 introduced by @RepTenney @CUNA supports this #CommonSenseReg
text: The House is now considering HR 3971, the Community Institution Mortgage Relief Act of 2017 introduced by @RepTenney @CUNA supports this #CommonSenseReg

html: With smaller staffs & less resources than large financial institutions, local institutions are unable to bear the regulatory burden that my bill would roll back. These regulations have driven local institutions out of the mortgage lending market, hurting our local communities.
text: With smaller staffs & less resources than large financial institutions, local institutions are unable to bear the regulatory burden that my bill would roll back. These regulations have driven local institutions out of the mortgage lending market, hurting our local communities.

html: The Community Institution Mortgage Relief Act will alleviate harmful burdens that drive our small community institutions out of the mortgage lending market. It will also roll back regulations that have doubled the cost of servicing loans for low-income borrowers.
text: The Community Institution Mortgage Relief Act will alleviate harmful burdens that drive our small community institutions out of the mortgage lending market. It will also roll back regulations that have doubled the cost of servicing loans for low-income borrowers.

html: The #TaxCutsAndJobsAct preserves the SALT deduction for property taxes up to $10,000. In #NY22, 99% of itemizers deduct less than $10,000 in property taxes. This provision will cover nearly all property owners.

html: I advocated so strongly for the SALT deduction because it shields NYers from the oppressive burden Albany places on taxpayers. Albany politicians have ZERO respect for the taxpayers. Governor Cuomo and Assembly liberals continue to increase our bloated budget while hiking taxes.
text: I advocated so strongly for the SALT deduction because it shields NYers from the oppressive burden Albany places on taxpayers. Albany politicians have ZERO respect for the taxpayers. Governor Cuomo and Assembly liberals continue to increase our bloated budget while hiking taxes.

html: H.R. 1 reduces the number of brackets and lowers tax rates in each, except for the rate on the highest income earners, which remains unchanged. All Americans deserve to keep more of what they earn and this bill will put more money in back in the paychecks of hardworking NYers.
text: H.R. 1 reduces the number of brackets and lowers tax rates in each, except for the rate on the highest income earners, which remains unchanged. All Americans deserve to keep more of what they earn and this bill will put more money in back in the paychecks of hardworking NYers.

html: While H.R. 1 is not perfect in its current form and there are changes I will continue to advocate for, especially on the SALT front, I strongly believe that passing this bill is a critical step forward to ensure our tax codes reflects the values of fairness and hard work. #NY22

html: On Friday, I introduced the Chuck Osier Burial Benefits Act. Named in honor of a veteran from #NY22 and inspired by his wife Donna, the bill will expand veteran’s benefits to reflect changing trends in burial practices by offering a commemorative urn or plaque minted by the VA.pic.twitter.com/cb7TI3Lu6a
text:
On Friday, I introduced the Chuck Osier Burial Benefits Act.
Named in honor of a veteran from #NY22 and inspired by his wife Donna, the bill will expand veteran’s benefits to reflect changing trends in burial practices by offering a commemorative urn or plaque minted by the VA.pic.twitter.com/cb7TI3Lu6a
